q: But it's still broadcasting, says its director, Sylvain Semilinko, despite death threats to staff members.`` We are not biased towards Mr. Gbagbo or biased towards Mr. Alassane Ouattara ,'' he says. We interview people from Gbagbo's camp as well as Alassane Ouattara 's. But recently, people from Gbagbo's camp declined to speak on U.N. radio. Semilinko adds:`` We don't say Alassane Ouattara is right, Gbagbo is wrong, etc, etc.. This is not for us to make a judgment. We have to cover the facts and that

U.S. Mike Pence shut the door Thursday on seeking the presidency in 2012 but left unanswered whether his choice instead is the Indiana Eric Holcomb 's office. I'm open to running for Eric Holcomb , Mike Pence said in an exclusive interview with The Indianapolis Star.`` We're going to take the next several months to travel across the state and hear what Hoosiers have to say. We'll seriously consider it.

Saying his`` heart was in Indiana,'' Mike Pence said he would continue to meet with the good and strong and opinionated people of this state before deciding his next move. During a question-and-answer session, Mike Pence said his proudest moment as a congressman came when he helped a Muncie mother avoid deportation to her home country of Sierra Leone.
